In a global project, the project manager has to plan and manage communication between the team members and stakeholders in order to ensure the project will remain on track and achieve its goals.

What should the project manager do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Consider cultural differences among stakeholders

By focusing on cultural differences, the project manager can create a communication plan that respects and incorporates the diverse backgrounds of all team members and stakeholders, thereby enhancing the likelihood of the project remaining on track and achieving its goals.

choices.B: Understand how political aspects can affect the project.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Option C emphasizes communication, collaboration, and regular updates through progress reports. It creates a structure for ongoing communication between the project manager and the local company, facilitating transparency and ensuring everyone stays informed about the project's status.

While both Option A and Option C are reasonable approaches, they differ slightly in their emphasis. Option A emphasizes "supervision" by the project manager, which may involve a more hands-on approach. On the other hand, Option C highlights "periodic progress reports," which promotes regular updates and a collaborative working relationship between the project manager and the local company.

questions.question_text:
A project team consisting of four team members will be rolling out a company-wide application to both staff and contractors in a country. To deliver within strict the time lines, a local company skilled in application deployment and change management will need to be contracted.
What should the project manager do to empower the local company?

choices.C: Set expectations and agree on the requirements that the contractor will deliver with periodic progress reports
choices.D: Deploy the contractor's staff under the supervision of the project manager
choices.B: Begin to roll out the application by micromanaging the contractor
choices.A: Manage expectations and agree on the requirements that the contractor will deliver under the supervision of the project manager

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In my opinion I feel engaging the agile resource over video conferencing will help as it will bridge the distance and is a practical low cost option however, if it fails Advise the sponsor that the project will be delayed as agile training will be required.

Selected Answer: A
I choose A. co-location is often preferred in agile methodologies to enhance communication and collaboration. However, given the strict schedule and budget constraints, relocating the agile resources might not be feasible.

While co-location can be ideal, daily video conferencing can still effectively bridge the gap. It allows for real-time communication, quick feedback loops, and maintaining team cohesion without the additional costs and logistical challenges of relocation.
